snippet: Analysis of differing approaches to unemployment insurance and its duration in the United States and Europe has not yet found an optimal length, an economist writes.
abstract: Analysis of differing approaches to unemployment insurance and its duration in the United States and Europe has not yet found an optimal length, an economist writes.
lead_paragraph: Casey B. Mulligan is an economics professor at the University of Chicago.

headline.main: In Europe, a Longer Perspective on Unemployment Benefits

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development
